page.lettertext:
fol.70r
[To M
r
] Bodly
M
r
Bodly sence my last I heare out
of the Country that the forces w
ch
weare
assembled for the rescue of
Gertrudenberg
are returned agayne to their Garisons, and
that the
Cownt Charles
unwillinge to
t
so far from the frontiers of
Fraunce
hath
assured them
of those
t
that he will beseage ostend
and that he will eyther take it or make
the stat
leave ther seege before Gertruden
berge and
Groningen
.
I would not faill to advertise you heare of
that you may help to solicitt the stat
to
send heather preasently provision of powder
Matche, Bullet
, Tooles to worke w
th
all, Musket
,
pykes, and all soche other thing
as are
necessary for a seege, w
ch
because I
know how moche you tender her
Majestys
service, I am suer you will procure w
th
all Care, and so have I wrytten to her
Majesty.
Thus sir, w
th
my most harty C
o
mendations
to your self and
M
r
Gilpin
so will C
o
mitt you
[.] Aprill 1593
your very loving freend Edward Norreys
